Title: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 37 for SLE 12 SP1)

Notes.Text: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 37 for SLE 12 SP1)
Notes.Title: Topic

Notes.Text:
This update for the Linux Kernel 3.12.74-60_64_124 fixes several issues.

The following security issues were fixed:

- CVE-2019-15917: Fixed a use-after-free issue when hci_uart_register_dev() fails in hci_uart_set_proto() in drivers/bluetooth/hci_ldisc.c (bsc#1156334).
- CVE-2019-17133: Fixed Buffer Overflow to reject long SSID IE in cfg80211_mgd_wext_giwessid in net/wireless/wext-sme.c(bsc#1153161).
Notes.Title: Details

Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.0.5. There is a use-after-free issue when hci_uart_register_dev() fails in hci_uart_set_proto() in drivers/bluetooth/hci_ldisc.c.

Vulnerabilities.Description: In the Linux kernel through 5.3.2, cfg80211_mgd_wext_giwessid in net/wireless/wext-sme.c does not reject a long SSID IE, leading to a Buffer Overflow.
